title: I was going to play some URF this weekend...
body: But I wanted to play a more casual game mode with less tryhards & more champion diversity, So I played ranked instead{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

replies.body:
I don't blame Riot for it.
URF was fun first 2 years (2 times) and it became less and less fun because the more you play it, the more meta established it becomes.
You can ban 6 most frustrating champions to play against and then the rest will take their place. Just one champion with an annoying ability that can use it constantly, becomes an anti-joy champion that gets rewarded for it and you just have to take it the entire game.

Moral of the story - unless you want to earn chests with annoying champions, play URF.
If this isn't your shtick, everything else would be more fun than URF.
I do blame Riot because they could easily make champ select random and that shit gets fixed.
Or disable some champs during URF week.

Riot did do this the first time because URF was genuinely fun but broken for some champions (Kassadin and Sona) and the second time, they revised it for healers and some abilities got their CDs increased artificially.
I also don't think this fixes the problem because more or less, there will always be another champion that's going to be annoying if you simply disable all the top tier ones.

The point is that the more you play URF, the more stale it becomes because you're seeing the same picks over and over again. URF is more or less there for the new players who want to screw around and experience the chaos for the first time.

The idea wasn't that there would never be top-tier champs for the mode, the idea was that by nerfing/disabling some outliers, the resulting second-string lineup that took their place would be a larger pool and therefore more varied.

Not saying it worked, that's just what I believe the design philosophy was.

That's a reasonable argument to make but why have a mode where certain champions are disabled? That doesn't look fun for the people who play these champions regularly and want a different experience with them.

On the other side, the community has already requested that URF becomes a permanent game mode and this is the reason why it won't - the mode is intentionally made to be imbalanced for the fun factor. URF mode has general buffs that augments every champion's ability (no resource costs, 80% CDR, AS/Crit buffs) which cover the entire champion pool and thanks to champion diversity - some champions are too good and some bad.

Attempting to balance the outliers will just flesh out the different roster. Mainly because League has too many champions and attempting the number adjustments on so many of them clearly doesn't work if you do it all at once.
With that said, this is why URF is in RGM queue.
I agree, URF would be better if they removed certain champions.  Or extend the amount banned to 10  a side  :)

You still have to take winning into account though because people are trying to win. Random would just make the game a lottery in champ select which is why i think that they should do nemesis draft instead.

I agree with a lot that you're saying, but I do completely blame Riot for it. I've seen suggestions for Riot to ban certain champions, but then other champions just take their place. What they need to do is *balance* champions in this game mode. I don't mean making sweeping adjustments like decreasing healing for all healers. I mean, take a champion that's ridiculously OP, like Urgot, and increase his cooldowns slightly *just* on URF. Sure, it would take time to actually balance champions individually..... so therefore it will never happen. Why care about actually fixing a game mode, that's such a strange concept
What if they made a randomized URF version?

I can't understand the harassment that goes on in URF. Everyone is expecting you to be able to play a champion as well as if you played them in Ranked...but it's URF. It's not supposed to be tense. That doesn't even account for the fact that some champions are blatantly more powerful in the mode and are 100% not fun to play against.

I think Riot needs to make it all Random, or ban some of the worst offenders of the Mode by default. Zed, Blitzcrank, Xin Zhao, and a few others ruin the experience big time when they make it through Pick/Ban.

OR Riot could make Turrets absolutely monstrous in URF. I think that'd be hilarious to watch them one-shot champions in URF given how they are as weak in URF now as they were at the beginning of Season 6. :^)

I disagree, but only because a pure PvP mode on the Crystal Scar with URF buffs would make champion diversity even worse. Right now, at least if you pick a team of only assassins in URF you give up SOME strengths, like objective control (unless you have a Zed, in which case you have pretty much everything covered). Making it solely about teamfights on a map that caters to ambushing lone targets with the URF buffs that make assassins almost impossible to 1v1...

So maybe a half-and-half solution: have a special map for URF, possibly inspired by some of the Heroes of the Storm map Towers of Doom. In that one, you can't attack the Nexus/Core directly; like with Dominion or Ascension, the only way to damage the base is by taking objectives. That said, split-pushing and taking towers turns them to your side, which weakens enemy objectives and empowers yours until it's taken back. Make important neutral objectives, but balance their importance with the ability to force fights/cater to other styles.

Towers of Doom isn't the *best* example, maybe, as stomps on that map are as fast or faster than stomp ARAM games. But the principle would work.

Urf just spiralled into a cancer festival after the first two times it was around. Now it's just pick a cancer champ or get destroyed by a cancer champ. Only thing it is good for now is to earn chests with Assasins.

They really need to either:

A) Make it draft so I can see what the enemy team is picking, give me some ability to see that they're going to pick 4 melee hard engage champs that are super annoying so I can pick Janna or something (or don't pick something that's gonna get hard countered)

B) Make it random and let you trade like ARAM, but give everyone 2 rerolls every game (I think the reroll mechanic for ARAM for a RGM would be too annoying, you just wanna be able to play) or give everyone 1 reroll every game.

C) Remove champions that are toxic/overpowered/ridiculous or nerf them. This would have to be an ongoing process every week, so I think the first two changes would probably be better.

I just feel like if people are going to try so hard to pick really overpowered team comps in Urf, they're really benefitting from Blind Draft allowing them to both have duplicate champs and pick without us seeing their picks. I get the whole idea of "this is a RGM for fun!" but I think it would be more fun if we could actually have some warning of the eve/nidalee/ekko team we're about to play against.

There's plenty of diversity if you go looking - Pantheon, Skarner, and Amumu, for example, are just as strong as Evelynn, Ryze, or Zed. One of my opponents yesterday was playing Shyvana and they almost carried the game. Be willing to experiment and you'll find some cool stuff.

(for Amumu, go tanky AP - Rylai's, Abyssal, and Protobelt are awesome.)

Pantheon is nowhere NEAR as strong as Eve. He just mathematically isn't.

Even champs like Yi and Hecarim cannot compete with Evelynn or Ryze, and that's saying something.
Numberwise maybe, but he has a stun and more map presence. As I said, there's power there if you pay attention.

and then you experiment and play against eve/nidalee/ekko/ryze and it doesn't matter that skarner is "just as strong" because he couldn't stealth into a lane at level 1 and use 50 hate spikes instantly

that's really the issue, a lot of the champs that are strong are strong for combinations of other things. Eve is strong because her damage is high but she also has stealth. Zed's damage is high but he has invuln in his ult and shadows. The champs you listed may have an equivalency for the damage portion of their kits, but there is no equivalency for having a shadow on a really short CD.

That's the issue - I'm all for "experimenting", and I've found some stuff that felt pretty strong, but overall it feels like all the enemy team has to do is keep the game going long enough and you lose.

All three I listed have repeatable stuns. Skarner can 1v1 towers with his W. Amumu, especially with protobelt, has great mobility and can do considerable damage despite having over 3k HP by the time you get to full build. Pantheon has his mandrop - he can be anywhere on the map as soon as you need him. Sure, in a straight fight Zed has high damage and mobility, but he can't take objectives or tank like Skarner, doesn't have the map presence of Pantheon, lacks the durability and initiation power of Amumu, and doesn't have the crowd control any of them have. There are equivalencies. You just aren't seeing them.
